Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps / AI / Weather Models / DevOps / ML
Description:
Senior MLOps Engineer - AI / Weather Models / DevOps / Machine Learning Engineer




MLOps Engineer needed to operationalize cutting-edge AI models that are solving critical, real-world weather and climate challenges. This is a foundational hire for someon excited about building and defining the Machine Learning Operations practice for a pioneering technology startup




Why Join?

Foundational Impact: This is a greenfield opportunity. You will be the first MLOps hire, empowered to build the infrastructure, processes, and culture for ML deployment from the ground up.
Career Growth: This role provides a clear pathway from a core operations focus into advanced data science, including model tuning and validation, offering significant professional development.
Cutting-Edge Problem Space: Work at the intersection of high-performance computing, big data, and climate technology, handling unique and complex geospatial datasets that are 20TB and larger.
Above-Market Rate Compensation: A highly competitive package including a strong base salary up to $230k, significant equity, a performance bonus, generous PTO, and relocation assistance is on offer for the right Senior MLOps Engineer.




The Company

My client is a well-funded, venture-backed startup with a mission to address some of the world's most pressing environmental questions. They are a leader in geospatial intelligence, leveraging vast, proprietary datasets from a dedicated satellite constellation to power advanced environmental models. By investing heavily in technology and science, they are providing critical insights that have a global impact.




The Role

As the primary MLOps Engineer, you will be the bridge between infrastructure and data science. Your main responsibility will be to build a robust, scalable environment for deploying and operating large, data-intensive AI foundation models.
Build, deploy, and maintain the high-performance computing and storage infrastructure (cloud or physical) for heavy ML workloads.
Take existing, complex AI/ML models and operationalize them at scale, ensuring they are running efficiently and reliably. Build new ones if you have the experience/ability!
Manage and manipulate exceptionally large and complex datasets, serving as the expert on data handling for ML applications.
Partner with a team of world-class scientists, establishing best practices for version control (Git), deployment, and monitoring.




The Essential Requirements

3+ years of experience in a MLOps or a DevOps. SRE in an AI/ML environment, or a similar technical role focused on high-performance computing (HPC) and data-heavy workloads.
Commercial experience building running, fine-tuning, or validating new and existing AI/ML models.
Familiarity with large-scale geographic, scientific, or remote sensing datasets.
A background or strong interest in weather / meteorological science or related fields.
Experience in an industry that involves GNSS or radar signal processing.
Demonstrable experience managing and manipulating exceptionally large datasets (20TB or larger).
A deep, foundational understanding of your engineering tools, with the ability to explain how they work "under the hood."
Strong, hands-on proficiency with Python and Linux.
Fluency with version control systems and processes, specifically Git.




This is a hybrid role requiring 3 days per week in-office. You must be located in or willing to relocate to either Golden, CO or the greater Boston, MA area (relocation assistance is provided).




What Will Make You Stand Out







If you are interested in this role, please apply with your resume through this site.




SEO Keywords for Search

MLOps Engineer, Senior DevOps Specialist, Lead Site Reliability Engineer, Python, Linux, High-Performance Computing, Lead MLOps Specialist, Big Data Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure, Platform Engineering, Git, Cloud Infrastructure, AI Operations, Geospatial Data, SRE, Climate Tech, Satellite Data, AWS, GCP, Azure, Data-Heavy Workloads, Scientific Computing.




Disclaimer

DISCLAIMER: No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, sex, race, religion or belief, disability, pregnancy and maternity, marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation, gender, and/or gender reassignment, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from anyone for this role. Attis Global Ltd operates as an employment agency and employment business. More information can be found at attisglobal.com.

Title: AI Lab Research Engineer
Description:
🚀 About Lila Sciences

Lila Sciences is the world’s first scientific superintelligence platform and autonomous lab for life, chemistry, and materials science.  We are pioneering a new age of boundless discovery by building the capabilities to apply AI to every aspect of the scientific method.  We are introducing scientific superintelligence to solve humankind's greatest challenges, enabling scientists to bring forth solutions in human health, climate, and sustainability at a pace and scale never experienced before. Learn more about this mission at  www.lila.ai  

At Lila, we are uniquely cross-functional and collaborative. We are actively reimagining the way teams work together and communicate. Therefore, we seek individuals with an inclusive mindset and a diversity of thought. Our teams thrive in unstructured and creative environments. All voices are heard because we know that experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way.

If this sounds like an environment you’d love to work in, even if you only have some of the experience listed below, please apply.

🌟 Your Impact at Lila

Lila Sciences is at the forefront of reimagining how scientific research is conducted through cutting-edge machine learning and AI. We are seeking talented and visionary AI Lab Research Engineer with relevant experience in developing scientific AI models to tackle complex, multi-step problems across domains to join our team. Title will be determined by merit and experience level. 

In this role, you will design, train, and deploy advanced AI agents capable of performing sequential decision-making, reasoning, and task completion in scientific contexts.

As an AI Lab Integration Research Engineer at Lila Sciences, you’ll work alongside experts in biology, materials science, automation, and other disciplines to push the boundaries of what’s possible with AI-driven research. You’ll play a key role in building agents that can reason, plan, and execute tasks across diverse scientific challenges, ultimately accelerating discovery and innovation.

🛠️ What You'll Be Building


Develop AI agents capable of solving complex, domain-specific scientific problems through sequential decision-making and multi-step reasoning.
Train and fine-tune models to adapt to specific scientific domains, ensuring robust performance on real-world research tasks.
Implement rigorous testing frameworks and benchmarks to evaluate agent capabilities and measure progress toward scientific objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI agents into experimental workflows, enabling faster iteration and discovery in areas such as biology, chemistry, and materials science.


🧰 What You’ll Need To Succeed


PhD or Masters in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) with a strong background in machine learning and one domain of science (e.g. biology or materials science).
Strong understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their application to scientific problem-solving, with a focus on domain adaptation and task-specific fine-tuning.
Proficiency in modern ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX) and experience implementing scalable solutions for complex tasks.


✨ Bonus Points For


Demonstrated expertise in developing AI agents for complex, long-range tasks.
Experience building custom benchmarks or evaluation frameworks to test agent performance on domain-specific challenges.
Contributions to high-impact research in machine learning and AI, particularly in areas such as sequential decision-making, reasoning, or multi-step problem-solving (e.g., publications in top-tier conferences like NeurIPS, ICML, AAAI, ICLR).
Familiarity with scientific data pipelines and workflows.


🌈 We’re All In

Lila Sciences is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

🤝 A Note to Agencies

Lila Sciences does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to Lila Sciences or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Lila Science’s internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of Lila Sciences, and Lila Sciences will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.

🚀 About Lila Sciences

Lila Sciences is the world’s first scientific superintelligence platform and autonomous lab for life, chemistry, and materials science.  We are pioneering a new age of boundless discovery by building the capabilities to apply AI to every aspect of the scientific method.  We are introducing scientific superintelligence to solve humankind's greatest challenges, enabling scientists to bring forth solutions in human health, climate, and sustainability at a pace and scale never experienced before. Learn more about this mission at  www.lila.ai  

At Lila, we are uniquely cross-functional and collaborative. We are actively reimagining the way teams work together and communicate. Therefore, we seek individuals with an inclusive mindset and a diversity of thought. Our teams thrive in unstructured and creative environments. All voices are heard because we know that experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way.

If this sounds like an environment you’d love to work in, even if you only have some of the experience listed below, please apply.

🌟 Your Impact at Lila

Lila Sciences is at the forefront of reimagining how scientific research is conducted through cutting-edge machine learning and AI. We are seeking talented and visionary AI Lab Research Engineer with relevant experience in developing scientific AI models to tackle complex, multi-step problems across domains to join our team. Title will be determined by merit and experience level. 

In this role, you will design, train, and deploy advanced AI agents capable of performing sequential decision-making, reasoning, and task completion in scientific contexts.

As an AI Lab Integration Research Engineer at Lila Sciences, you’ll work alongside experts in biology, materials science, automation, and other disciplines to push the boundaries of what’s possible with AI-driven research. You’ll play a key role in building agents that can reason, plan, and execute tasks across diverse scientific challenges, ultimately accelerating discovery and innovation.

🛠️ What You'll Be Building

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI agents into experimental workflows, enabling faster iteration and discovery in areas such as biology, chemistry, and materials science.

🧰 What You’ll Need To Succeed

  • PhD or Masters in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) with a strong background in machine learning and one domain of science (e.g. biology or materials science).
  • Strong understanding of large language models (LLMs) and their application to scientific problem-solving, with a focus on domain adaptation and task-specific fine-tuning.
  • Proficiency in modern ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX) and experience implementing scalable solutions for complex tasks.

✨ Bonus Points For

  • Demonstrated expertise in developing AI agents for complex, long-range tasks.
  • Experience building custom benchmarks or evaluation frameworks to test agent performance on domain-specific challenges.
  • Contributions to high-impact research in machine learning and AI, particularly in areas such as sequential decision-making, reasoning, or multi-step problem-solving (e.g., publications in top-tier conferences like NeurIPS, ICML, AAAI, ICLR).
  • Familiarity with scientific data pipelines and workflows.

🌈 We’re All In

Lila Sciences is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

🤝 A Note to Agencies

Lila Sciences does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than candidates. The submission of unsolicited resumes by recruitment or staffing agencies to Lila Sciences or its employees is strictly prohibited unless contacted directly by Lila Science’s internal Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted by an agency in the absence of a signed agreement will automatically become the property of Lila Sciences, and Lila Sciences will not owe any referral or other fees with respect thereto.
